projects.brand_about: TELx is the user-owned decentralized liquidity network of the V3 Telcoin platform. Users deposit their cryptocurrency into TELx staking contracts to become liquidity providers. In return, they receive crypto currency rewards for allowing their tokens to be used to power transactions on the Telcoin platform.
projects.name: TELx DeFi Liquidity Portal Design & Development

text.content: As Head of Design at Telcoin, I was tasked with designing multiple brands, interfaces, apps, and marketing materials during 2021 Q2. TELx is one of them.

rich_text.plain_text: As Head of Design at Telcoin, I was tasked with designing multiple brands, interfaces, apps, and marketing materials during 2021 Q2. TELx is one of them.

text.content: To understand TELx, we first have to understand two concepts: The V3 Telcoin Platform (info released July 1, 2021) and

rich_text.plain_text: To understand TELx, we first have to understand two concepts: The V3 Telcoin Platform (info released July 1, 2021) and

text.content: Telcoin is currently known for its main product, sending remittances for a fraction of the cost of competitors. With the V3 Platform, we are going much farther than remittances. The platform is intended to be an all-inclusive, wholistic approach to the future of decentralized finance. It will empower and improve the lives of millions of people globally.

The platform is intended to be an all-inclusive, wholistic approach to the future of decentralized finance. It will empower and improve the lives of millions of people globally.

text.content: The field of Decentralized Finance is quite new, and there are few good examples to draw from. Almost every project in DeFi simply forks

text.content: Telcoin is different. We are creating a different stack of products, and that calls for a fundamental shift in design and user experience. Therefore, it was my job to rethink the experience from first principles and create an experience that was unmistakably "TELx". Specifically, it focuses on the "Product" concept, organizing based on product, and is far more descriptive and clear about focusing the user's attention on things that matter, while being helpful when concepts have a high learning curve.

text.content: This was my first time creating code to interact with the blockchain. At first it's a daunting task because people will be using the interface to take financial actions. However, there is solace in the fact that their funds are always safe on the blockchain, and the interface is simply a means of interacting with the blockchain.

rich_text.plain_text: This was my first time creating code to interact with the blockchain. At first it's a daunting task because people will be using the interface to take financial actions. However, there is solace in the fact that their funds are always safe on the blockchain, and the interface is simply a means of interacting with the blockchain.

text.content: My colleague Amir helped greatly with the backend, and the app would not function without him. In order to complete the frontend, however, we needed to give people a way to interact with the contracts.

text.content: TELx was one of those projects that started as a small idea, then grew and grew into a powerful entity. Requirements were introduced organically, one after the other, each with their own challenges and "how the f do I do that" moments. TELx was my most challenging project to date, and I am immensely proud of it. Balancing the design and development with other projects added sleepless nights and years to my life, but I am passionate and confident that this puzzle piece will leave a dent in the universe. More to come with TELx and the whole platform.

projects.brand_about: Namonai is a online art platform based in Tokyo. The company nurtures and empowers budding Japanese artists tomanage andsell their artworkglobally. The name 'Namonai' is Japanese, , meaning 'Not even a name'. We aim to build this platform for Japanese artists who can not even claim a name yet. I am a co-founder.
projects.name: Namonai Brand, eCommerce Web Design, Frontend Development
projects.project_about:
Only 1% of the global art market is Japanese-speaking (Japan). Around 83% of the global market is English and Chinese-speaking (USA, England, China). We believe there is a high, unmet demand for Japanese art in these countries.
We are creating Namonai as a platform that breaks the Japanese-English and Japanese-Chinese language barriers to give Japanese artists a fair chance to sell their art and 'make a name' for themselves globally.
At this stage, most of my efforts focus on UXUI Design and Frontend Development of Namonai's E-Commerce site. This case study will outline my approach and general thinking for this project.
projects.seo_description: Namonai is an online fine art management platform based in Tokyo. The company helps undiscovered Japanese artistsmanage andsell their artworkglobally through digital marketing and custom web applications.

text.content: Namonai branding is based on balance and simplicity. Our aim is to be as minimal as possible while still providing functional UX. This is to allow user artwork to shine. Namonai focuses on its artists, and therefore the brand should guide users to focus on the artists as well. Namonai is not pretentious or haughty. It's a helping hand.

rich_text.plain_text: Namonai branding is based on balance and simplicity. Our aim is to be as minimal as possible while still providing functional UX. This is to allow user artwork to shine. Namonai focuses on its artists, and therefore the brand should guide users to focus on the artists as well. Namonai is not pretentious or haughty. It's a helping hand.

text.content: The E-Commerce sitemap shows the types of static and dynamic pages in the site. Pages are divided into three categories:

rich_text.plain_text: The E-Commerce sitemap shows the types of static and dynamic pages in the site. Pages are divided into three categories:

text.content: Browsing (presentational) - for finding artwork and artists that the user likes.

rich_text.plain_text: Browsing (presentational) - for finding artwork and artists that the user likes.

text.content: Accounts (operational) - for bookmarking and buying artwork.

rich_text.plain_text: Accounts (operational) - for bookmarking and buying artwork.

text.content: Using the brand, mission, and site structure, I could begin to design the EC website. Again, the site is intentionally designed to focus on the artists and their artwork while the Namonai brand gracefully submits to a helpful information delivery platform in the background.

rich_text.plain_text: Using the brand, mission, and site structure, I could begin to design the EC website. Again, the site is intentionally designed to focus on the artists and their artwork while the Namonai brand gracefully submits to a helpful information delivery platform in the background.

text.content: The artist page is intended to act as a full-feature portfolio page for any artist that signs up for Namonai. After browsing several artists' profiles on other websites, there were a few common pieces of information:

rich_text.plain_text: The artist page is intended to act as a full-feature portfolio page for any artist that signs up for Namonai. After browsing several artists' profiles on other websites, there were a few common pieces of information:

text.content: We also provide an editable background hero image so the artist can add their own flare to their portfolio. The design focuses on artist content while balancing a familiar template layout for each artist that will provide familiarity and ease of use to the viewer.

rich_text.plain_text: We also provide an editable background hero image so the artist can add their own flare to their portfolio. The design focuses on artist content while balancing a familiar template layout for each artist that will provide familiarity and ease of use to the viewer.

text.content: The single artwork page lists all information and features that a user would need to consider buying an artwork from an artist. The design is inspired from my experience with Shopify product pages. It includes:

rich_text.plain_text: The single artwork page lists all information and features that a user would need to consider buying an artwork from an artist. The design is inspired from my experience with Shopify product pages. It includes:

text.content: Multiple, accessible shots of the artwork

rich_text.plain_text: Multiple, accessible shots of the artwork

text.content: An image to help the user imagine the artwork in real space

rich_text.plain_text: An image to help the user imagine the artwork in real space

text.content: An interesting (for non-Japanese) part of this design is the inquire button. According to our advisers, many Japanese do not like making the prices of their artwork public. Therefore, we are offering our artists the option to either display the price or inquire.

rich_text.plain_text: An interesting (for non-Japanese) part of this design is the inquire button. According to our advisers, many Japanese do not like making the prices of their artwork public. Therefore, we are offering our artists the option to either display the price or inquire.

text.content: Following, there are sections for more artwork from the artist, and other artwork suggestions. This is to offer the user more suggestions curtailed to their tastes (a concept heavily employed at Amazon).

rich_text.plain_text: Following, there are sections for more artwork from the artist, and other artwork suggestions. This is to offer the user more suggestions curtailed to their tastes (a concept heavily employed at Amazon).

text.content: I'm not a fan of most account pages - too many options. This account page is focused on the minimum information that we will need from a user to send them art when they purchase.

rich_text.plain_text: I'm not a fan of most account pages - too many options. This account page is focused on the minimum information that we will need from a user to send them art when they purchase.

text.content: The user can access this page by clicking on their profile picture in the top navigation bar. Personal information and payment information are both laid out on the same screen for simplicity. The word 'my' is used when possible, and the user's profile picture and name are emphasized to elicit a positive emotional response. Heading sizes are intentionally chosen in a clear h1, h2, h3 order to guide the users' eyes to the correct information as quickly as possible. Buttons are well pronounced and easily identifiable.

rich_text.plain_text: The user can access this page by clicking on their profile picture in the top navigation bar. Personal information and payment information are both laid out on the same screen for simplicity. The word 'my' is used when possible, and the user's profile picture and name are emphasized to elicit a positive emotional response. Heading sizes are intentionally chosen in a clear h1, h2, h3 order to guide the users' eyes to the correct information as quickly as possible. Buttons are well pronounced and easily identifiable.

text.content: The Checkout page is inspired by UX from Amazon's checkout process confirmation page. The main functions include:

rich_text.plain_text: The Checkout page is inspired by UX from Amazon's checkout process confirmation page. The main functions include:

text.content: Viewing order summary and placing order

rich_text.plain_text: Viewing order summary and placing order

text.content: In addition, I took care to ensure that the overall user experience of the checkout process matched Namonai's brand: clear and simple.

rich_text.plain_text: In addition, I took care to ensure that the overall user experience of the checkout process matched Namonai's brand: clear and simple.

text.content: We will complete version 1 of the Namonai E-Commerce site at the end of February, 2021. From there, we will test our international marketing hypotheses and continue to build our artists pool. If you'd like to learn more about our current curated artists, you can check out the Instagram page

projects.brand_about: Celebideo is a new app that I'm helping design and build for the Japanese market. It's like Cameo, where you can hire your favorite celebrities to make custom videos for you, but targeted as a B2B service for talent agencies in Japan. I'm currently designing and developing the consumer-facing React Native MVP.
projects.name: Celebideo React Native App
projects.project_about:
This project is basically split into two parts:
1. A mobile app that users can use to browse and request videos from their favorite Japanese celebrities (that I'm currently designing/developing)
2. A management system for the agencies who manage their celebrities (my colleage Alex King is developing). After hearing the project requirements in late December 2020, I designed a rough MVP

text.content: For Celebideo, I first focused on making the app as easy to navigate as possible. There are five main views: Home, Search, My Videos, My Orders, and Account. The user can access first order priorities from these five views.

rich_text.plain_text: For Celebideo, I first focused on making the app as easy to navigate as possible. There are five main views: Home, Search, My Videos, My Orders, and Account. The user can access first order priorities from these five views.

text.content: As with more and more platforms these days, horizontal swiping carousels enable the user to quickly browse through talents, maintaining their interest through familiar but exciting visual communication. Celebideo's browsing experience focuses on large, grouped image cards, some even moving.

rich_text.plain_text: As with more and more platforms these days, horizontal swiping carousels enable the user to quickly browse through talents, maintaining their interest through familiar but exciting visual communication. Celebideo's browsing experience focuses on large, grouped image cards, some even moving.

text.content: Branded styles are mainly a dark gray variety with some gold peppered on here and there. The dark gray styles were chosen for their feelings of mystery, power, elegance, and sophistication. Gold, for its feelings of stardom and magic. My goal was to mix the magic feeling of meeting your favorite celebrity with a professional looking platform that would support the high prices for the videos visually.

rich_text.plain_text: Branded styles are mainly a dark gray variety with some gold peppered on here and there. The dark gray styles were chosen for their feelings of mystery, power, elegance, and sophistication. Gold, for its feelings of stardom and magic. My goal was to mix the magic feeling of meeting your favorite celebrity with a professional looking platform that would support the high prices for the videos visually.

text.content: Alex and I chose to build the app in React Native because of its popularity, and because we are already very familiar with React. React Native conveniently exports your app to both iOS and Android when you release it, so you can keep one clean, maintainable code base for the app on all platforms.

rich_text.plain_text: Alex and I chose to build the app in React Native because of its popularity, and because we are already very familiar with React. React Native conveniently exports your app to both iOS and Android when you release it, so you can keep one clean, maintainable code base for the app on all platforms.

text.content: Magnus is proving to be an excellent component utility library. I particularly like their inline styles as parameter functionality, and the documentation is comprehensive and easy to understand.

rich_text.plain_text: Magnus is proving to be an excellent component utility library. I particularly like their inline styles as parameter functionality, and the documentation is comprehensive and easy to understand.

text.content: Creating this project is the most fun I've had in a long time, and the development is proceeding better than any of us could have hoped.

rich_text.plain_text: Creating this project is the most fun I've had in a long time, and the development is proceeding better than any of us could have hoped.

projects.brand_about: Cunard Line is a luxury British cruise line that owns and operates three cruise ships: Queen Mary 2, Queen Elizabeth, and Queen Victoria. One of these ships, Queen Elizabeth, often cruises exclusively around Japan.
projects.name: Cunard.jp
projects.project_about: In 2019, Cunard focused on business expansion in Japan through digital and traditional marketing efforts. Over the course of three months, through various meetings with the Japan CEO, I redesigned the then-outdated
projects.seo_description: Cunard Line is a luxury British cruise line that owns and operates three cruise ships: Queen Mary 2, Queen Elizabeth, and Queen Victoria. One of these ships, Queen Elizabeth, often cruises exclusively around Japan.

text.content: Cunard - Before and After Website Redesign

rich_text.plain_text: Cunard - Before and After Website Redesign

text.content: Above you can see the cunard.jp website before (2018) and after (2019) the redesign. The old design is based on a digital version of Japanese 'chirashi', basically flyers that shops hand out in Japan to market their products.

rich_text.plain_text: Above you can see the cunard.jp website before (2018) and after (2019) the redesign. The old design is based on a digital version of Japanese 'chirashi', basically flyers that shops hand out in Japan to market their products.

text.content: Matches the global brand with common components.

rich_text.plain_text: Matches the global brand with common components.

text.content: Before designing a new website for the Japanese market, I needed to understand who I was designing for. The global luxury market has a very specific taste, and the Japanese luxury market has a niche taste. I learned that I was not designing for anyone under the age of 60, and that the decision-makers were in fact housewives with retired husbands and a large savings. They crave the exotic feeling of foreign luxury with the comfort of domestic familiarity. These wives treat themselves and their husbands to luxury British cruises around Japan. I developed Toshiko Sato, a respectable and mature Japanese woman who now wishes to enjoy the finer things in life with her husband.

rich_text.plain_text: Before designing a new website for the Japanese market, I needed to understand who I was designing for. The global luxury market has a very specific taste, and the Japanese luxury market has a niche taste. I learned that I was not designing for anyone under the age of 60, and that the decision-makers were in fact housewives with retired husbands and a large savings. They crave the exotic feeling of foreign luxury with the comfort of domestic familiarity. These wives treat themselves and their husbands to luxury British cruises around Japan. I developed Toshiko Sato, a respectable and mature Japanese woman who now wishes to enjoy the finer things in life with her husband.

text.content: The British version of the Cunard website had been recreated within the past year. Included in it were html elements with Cunard branded styles. And though the site did not include all components that we needed, it gave me a good idea of design definitions for fundamental elements like buttons, links, heading proportions, cards, carousels, spreads, and imagery. The grid and column definitions for the Japanese site are unique, as I ensured uniformity throughout mobile, tablet, and desktop designs. Sadly, I was not able to access any of the design files that they created in England, so I began building our own Sketch Brand Asset Library. Together with designer Junon Hwang, we also set the Japanese typefaces for Cunard Japan.

rich_text.plain_text: The British version of the Cunard website had been recreated within the past year. Included in it were html elements with Cunard branded styles. And though the site did not include all components that we needed, it gave me a good idea of design definitions for fundamental elements like buttons, links, heading proportions, cards, carousels, spreads, and imagery. The grid and column definitions for the Japanese site are unique, as I ensured uniformity throughout mobile, tablet, and desktop designs. Sadly, I was not able to access any of the design files that they created in England, so I began building our own Sketch Brand Asset Library. Together with designer Junon Hwang, we also set the Japanese typefaces for Cunard Japan.

text.content: As with all cruise sites, the main of purpose of the former Cunard website was to allow users to search for cruises and learn about the Cunard brand. The Japanese version of the site had an extra distinction in that cruises were mainly of three types: those around Japan, those that are international (such as those through the Norwegian Fjords or through Southeast Asia), and those that circled the world. Thus, the UX design of the website needed to take these into consideration. In addition, other Japan-specific sections of the site needed to be considered such as new-grad recruiting, a newsroom, and special offers. All pages were completely redesigned.

rich_text.plain_text: As with all cruise sites, the main of purpose of the former Cunard website was to allow users to search for cruises and learn about the Cunard brand. Thus, the UX design of the website needed to take these into consideration. In addition, other Japan-specific sections of the site needed to be considered such as new-grad recruiting, a newsroom, and special offers. All pages were completely redesigned.

text.content: Youll notice that there is a lot of information on every page. This is one of the main distinctions between Japanese web design and Western web design. While Western web design focuses only on the information that you need to make a decision, Japanese web design expects all information on one, very long page. In fact, when Japanese view Western designed websites, they often feel as if the design is samishii or lonely due to the lack of information.

rich_text.plain_text: Youll notice that there is a lot of information on every page. This is one of the main distinctions between Japanese web design and Western web design. While Western web design focuses only on the information that you need to make a decision, Japanese web design expects all information on one, very long page. In fact, when Japanese view Western designed websites, they often feel as if the design is samishii or lonely due to the lack of information.

text.content: Cunard - Home Page UI Design (Desktop, Tablet, Mobile). Sketch.

rich_text.plain_text: Cunard - Home Page UI Design (Desktop, Tablet, Mobile). Sketch.

text.content: With ample consideration for the Japanese taste and a component library in Sketch, I was able to streamline the websites UI design process. Altogether, I designed 24 main page layouts with desktop, tablet, and mobile versions in order to ensure that our partner development company had the specifications they needed to build a site to Cunards high expectations. After all, we were creating for one of the most revered luxury brands in the world. Due to the cruise information pages, the actual site has hundreds of pages. Because of time and financial constraints, we were not able to create a dynamic route module to map cruise routes dynamically, so I also created a few hundred custom map illustrations. Using my designs, the website was developed with a custom WordPress build.

rich_text.plain_text: With ample consideration for the Japanese taste and a component library in Sketch, I was able to streamline the websites UI design process. Altogether, I designed 24 main page layouts with desktop, tablet, and mobile versions in order to ensure that our partner development company had the specifications they needed to build a site to Cunards high expectations. After all, we were creating for one of the most revered luxury brands in the world. Due to the cruise information pages, the actual site has hundreds of pages. Because of time and financial constraints, we were not able to create a dynamic route module to map cruise routes dynamically, so I also created a few hundred custom map illustrations. Using my designs, the website was developed with a custom WordPress build.

text.content: The sheer volume of information I worked with on the Cunard.jp project provided a excellent challenge and has been the largest project Ive ever worked on to date. In addition, all content and meetings were in Japanese which posed another challenge for me. The final site is comprehensive, and I am proud of the result. I learned a lot about not only web design, but also luxury business, Japanese localization, and pitching in a corporate setting.

rich_text.plain_text: The sheer volume of information I worked with on the Cunard.jp project provided a excellent challenge and has been the largest project Ive ever worked on to date. projects.brand_about: Masa Suzuki is a leading acrobatic athlete, performer, dancer, and teacher in Tokyo. He worked as a professional performer in Japan and the United States before teaching at Gymnastikhjskolen i Ollerup, a prestigious physical education academy in Denmark. From there he moved to Japan to work as a freelance Parkour & Movement Coach in order to spread what he learned while living in Europe.
projects.name: PKMASA Brand Design, English/Japanese  Wordpress Website Design and Development
projects.project_about: Masa asked me to create a logo and brand to help him promote his acrobatic teaching business and freelance performing. After creating a brand that we both loved, I then set up his bilingual (English and Japanese) Wordpress website that he can easily update and edit on his own.
projects.seo_description: Masa Suzuki is a leading acrobatic athlete, performer, dancer, and teacher in Tokyo. He now lives in Japan working freelance Parkour & Movement Coach.

text.content: The brand for PKMASA was a fun passion project for me, as Ive always been interested in urban street culture. As Masa is an extremely talented urban Parkour artist at heart, I looked into other parkour brands to see the types of colors, fonts, and imagery that these brands have. Many used multiple shades of gray and one or two warm accent colors, assumably to represent the edginess but excitement of urban city life. We chose high contrast grays to represent the buildings of Tokyo, and a vibrant yellow color representing Masas tangible positivity and energy. The logo is a monkey, modeled after a screenshot of Masa from one of his parkour videos. He is knows as

As Masa is an extremely talented urban Parkour artist at heart, I looked into other parkour brands to see the types of colors, fonts, and imagery that these brands have. Many used multiple shades of gray and one or two warm accent colors, assumably to represent the edginess but excitement of urban city life. We chose high contrast grays to represent the buildings of Tokyo, and a vibrant yellow color representing Masas tangible positivity and energy. The logo is a monkey, modeled after a screenshot of Masa from one of his parkour videos. He is knows as

text.content: , or The Monkey King, amongst peers.

rich_text.plain_text: , or The Monkey King, amongst peers.

text.content: The goal of Masas website was to showcase his acrobatic skills, allow people to see when hes teaching, and get in contact with him for lessons. Masas students are both Japanese and non-Japanese, so the site must show both English and Japanese in order to cater to his target markets. He wanted to use the website to not only explain but also teach complicated topics such as parkour, Movement practice, conditioning, and acrobatic dancing. To achieve this, I designed and set up a custom Wordpress website for him so that he could continue to easily create and edit pages on these topics. As of this writing, the website has around 30-40 pages.

rich_text.plain_text: The goal of Masas website was to showcase his acrobatic skills, allow people to see when hes teaching, and get in contact with him for lessons. Masas students are both Japanese and non-Japanese, so the site must show both English and Japanese in order to cater to his target markets. He wanted to use the website to not only explain but also teach complicated topics such as parkour, Movement practice, conditioning, and acrobatic dancing. To achieve this, I designed and set up a custom Wordpress website for him so that he could continue to easily create and edit pages on these topics. As of this writing, the website has around 30-40 pages.

text.content: Helping Masa solidify his brand image and create a digital hub for his knowledge and offerings was a rewarding experience. I am very happy with the brand. As this was one of the first Wordpress websites I made customizing an existing template and page builder Elementor, working with the builder is challenging. While this allows Masa to create any page layout hed like on his own, I believe the design suffers. Therefore, I learned how to balance design with business requirements. Either way, Masa loves his website.

text.content: SIRUP is a Japanese R&B / Hip Hop singer based in Tokyo. His YouTube music videos have gathered millions of views. Unknown to many, SIRUP had actually been a famous singer in Japan already, and this new name is a rebrand. Going off of a logo, we helped design the online SIRUP experience from scratch with a website that was easily maintainable, stylish, responsive, and ready to market his great music. We chose Wordpress because:

Unknown to many, SIRUP had actually been a famous singer in Japan already, and this new name is a rebrand. We chose Wordpress because:

text.content: Trustworthiness. Around 37% of the web is built on Wordpress (according to Wordpress).

rich_text.plain_text: Trustworthiness. Around 37% of the web is built on Wordpress (according to Wordpress).

text.content: Maintainability. Its easy to update your websites content by yourself. SIRUP was looking for a powerful solution that he could customize to his liking.

rich_text.plain_text: Maintainability. Its easy to update your websites content by yourself. SIRUP was looking for a powerful solution that he could customize to his liking.

text.content: SEO. Because Wordpress offers plugins like Yoast to optimize SEO, Masa was able to easily rise to the top in Google Search results.

rich_text.plain_text: SEO. Because Wordpress offers plugins like Yoast to optimize SEO, Masa was able to easily rise to the top in Google Search results.

text.content: Community. Wordpress has been around since 2003, and during that time its developers have worked hard to create a safe platform that anyone can build upon. Since then, developers have built an infinite number of plugins that others can easily use to increase the sites effectiveness.

singlePages.name: About
singlePages.overview: Digital Designer, Frontend Developer, and Digital Producer with nine+ years of professional experience in the US, Japan, and China.

text.content: Josh is a seasoned digital designer, frontend engineer, and digital producer. With nine+ years of professional experience spanning the United States, Japan, and China, he now resides in Miami, Florida, where he serves full-time as VP Design at Telcoin.

rich_text.plain_text: Josh is a seasoned digital designer, frontend engineer, and digital producer. With nine+ years of professional experience spanning the United States, Japan, and China, he now resides in Miami, Florida, where he serves full-time as VP Design at Telcoin.

text.content: Josh's overarching mission is to enhance the lives of 1,000,000 individuals by addressing complex challenges with straightforward digital design and application solutions.

rich_text.plain_text: Josh's overarching mission is to enhance the lives of 1,000,000 individuals by addressing complex challenges with straightforward digital design and application solutions.

text.content: Josh has designed and coded 30+ digital products, websites, and apps, for company sizes ranging from multinational corporations to budding startups across a variety of sectors. Some examples of sectors include eCommerce, investment banking, data analytics, telecommunications, food & beverage, music, entertainment, art commerce, blockchain, decentralized finance, and web3. He is incredibly passionate about the intersection of AI, blockchain, and finance.

rich_text.plain_text: Josh has designed and coded 30+ digital products, websites, and apps, for company sizes ranging from multinational corporations to budding startups across a variety of sectors. Some examples of sectors include eCommerce, investment banking, data analytics, telecommunications, food & beverage, music, entertainment, art commerce, blockchain, decentralized finance, and web3. He is incredibly passionate about the intersection of AI, blockchain, and finance.

text.content: Born in Okinawa, Japan, to a military family, Josh relocated to the United States when he was just two years old. His childhood was spent in many states, including North Carolina, Alaska, California, Florida, and Minnesota. Always a creative spirit, his teenage years were filled with musical endeavors and a foray into small business through 20+ part-time roles, ranging from freelance photography to bartending to English teaching.

rich_text.plain_text: Born in Okinawa, Japan, to a military family, Josh relocated to the United States when he was just two years old. His childhood was spent in many states, including North Carolina, Alaska, California, Florida, and Minnesota. Always a creative spirit, his teenage years were filled with musical endeavors and a foray into small business through 20+ part-time roles, ranging from freelance photography to bartending to English teaching.

text.content: Uncertain about his career direction, Josh began his academic journey in business school in 2010, eventually settling on an undergraduate degree in marketing. This choice allowed him to merge his passion for design and branding with the intricacies of psychology to solve real business goals. Concurrently, he began freelancing, designing marketing materials and websites that drew from the marketing principles he was studying.

rich_text.plain_text: Uncertain about his career direction, Josh began his academic journey in business school in 2010, eventually settling on an undergraduate degree in marketing. This choice allowed him to merge his passion for design and branding with the intricacies of psychology to solve real business goals. Concurrently, he began freelancing, designing marketing materials and websites that drew from the marketing principles he was studying.

text.content: Upon earning his BS degree in Marketing from the University of Minnesota Carlson School of Management, Josh's wanderlust led him back to his birthplace, Japan. In 2014, he enrolled in a bilateral exchange program at Sophia University in Tokyo, immersing himself in the Japanese language and the nuances of Japanese business culture.

rich_text.plain_text: Upon earning his BS degree in Marketing from the University of Minnesota Carlson School of Management, Josh's wanderlust led him back to his birthplace, Japan. In 2014, he enrolled in a bilateral exchange program at Sophia University in Tokyo, immersing himself in the Japanese language and the nuances of Japanese business culture.

text.content: Post-graduation, Josh secured a position as a web designer and frontend engineer at Rakuten's Creative Web Department in Tokyo. Over the next four to five years, he ventured into various roles in the Japanese tech, finance, and advertising sectors, even establishing his own freelance business. However, feeling he had reached a professional plateau, Josh returned to the U.S. in 2020, eager to tap into the tech industry's vast opportunities.

rich_text.plain_text: Post-graduation, Josh secured a position as a web designer and frontend engineer at Rakuten's Creative Web Department in Tokyo. Over the next four to five years, he ventured into various roles in the Japanese tech, finance, and advertising sectors, even establishing his own freelance business. However, feeling he had reached a professional plateau, Josh returned to the U.S. in 2020, eager to tap into the tech industry's vast opportunities.

text.content: In early 2021, Telcoin brought him on board as their Head of Design. Hes since been promoted to VP Design. In this role, Josh has cultivated a profound appreciation for blockchain and its potential, particularly in decentralized finance and web3. Since joining Telcoin we has led the design of their  webapps, and mobile iOS/Android app, and brand, while concurrently producing and managing all of Telcoins webapps.

rich_text.plain_text: In early 2021, Telcoin brought him on board as their Head of Design. Hes since been promoted to VP Design. In this role, Josh has cultivated a profound appreciation for blockchain and its potential, particularly in decentralized finance and web3. Since joining Telcoin we has led the design of their  webapps, and mobile iOS/Android app, and brand, while concurrently producing and managing all of Telcoins webapps.

text.content: When Josh isnt designing or developing, he enjoys studying macroeconomics via Real Vision, exploring AI businesses and tools, organizing his thoughts in Notion, and learning from mentors. He goes to the gym every day, attends yoga on weekends, and loves capturing fading moments through his photography. Josh speaks Japanese with business level proficiency and is studying to do the same in Spanish. You can generally find him attending DJ events (house, bass, deep house, hardstyle) on weekends with his friends in Miami. He has 6 tattoos, a pet bearded dragon, and no car.

text.content: This webapp was designed in Figma in August 2023. The data is managed by the Notion API, a collection of databases that function as a free CMS. The frontend is created in Next.js, with Typescript React.js and TailwindCSS with some help from ChatGPT4 (Joshs favorite frontend tech stack).

The frontend is created in Next.js, with Typescript React.js and TailwindCSS with some help from ChatGPT4 (Joshs favorite frontend tech stack).
